discussion.content: Question states “media” packet. Shouldn’t answer be A?

questions.question_text: What is the standard Layer 3 DSCP media packet value that should be set for Cisco TelePresence endpoints?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is troubleshooting a Cisco VCS Control call-routing issue. What happens when ccnpcollab is dialed?

discussion.content: Should be A as rule is Disabled

choices.D: The call is routed as ccnpcollab@cisco.com
choices.A: The call is routed as ccnpcollab.
choices.C: The call is routed to cisco.com as ccnpcollab

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

An engineer receives a ticket to troubleshoot a one-way audio issue with these symptoms:
✑ User A can hear user and vice versa.
✑ User A can hear user C, however user cannot hear user A.
✑ User can heat user C, however user cannot hear user .
Which two properties are the most likely reasons for this issue? (Choose two.)

choices.C: The router does not have a route back from the DMZ to the internal network.
choices.D: The Cisco EX60 of user С is not responding to requests coming from the TMS server.
choices.E: The Cisco EX60 default gateway of user С is missing from the network configuration.
choices.A: The Cisco VCS Expressway is not responding to the SIP INVITE coming from the Cisco VCS Control.
choices.B: The NAT device is allowing only RTP/RTCP ports from the DMZ to the internal network.

questions.question_text: You have deployed a Cisco 2821 ISR to perform as an SRST voice gateway at a remote site. During a network failure between the remote site and the central office, some of the phones located at the remote site are unable to make phone calls. Which two options are potential causes of the problem? (Choose two.)

choices.D: The site has exceeded the number of simultaneous calls allowed in SRST mode.
choices.A: The ccm-manager fallback-mgcp command is configured incorrectly on the voice gateway.
choices.C: Some phones at the remote site are assigned to a device pool without SRST reference.
choices.E: The ccm-manager fallback command is configured incorrectly on the voice gateway.
choices.B: The site has exceeded the number of SRST endpoints supported by the voice gateway.

choices.D: A device profile has most of the same attributes as a physical device.
choices.A: Devices can be configured to allow more than one user to be logged in at the same time.
choices.C: After an autogenerated device profile is created, you can associate it with one or more users.
choices.B: If no one is logged in, the phone uses either an auto generated profile or a user defined profile.
choices.E: An autogenerated device profiles can be loaded on a device at the same time as a user profile.

discussion.content:
Sorry Forget the above response.
Correct answers according to SNDR are B & D.
The autogenerated device profile represents a special device profile that gets generated when you configure a phone for Cisco CallManager Extension Mobility and choose "Use Current Settings" from the Phone Configuration window. The autogenerated device profile then associates with a specific phone to be the logout device profile. 
You cannot associate an autogenerated device profile with a user. An autogenerated device profile can be loaded onto a device only when no user is logged in.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about Cisco Unified Communications Manager Extension Mobility are true? (Choose two.)
